intro: Fuertesimalva peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
